intro: Byttneria corchorifolia, commonly known as the African mallow, is a shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces small, yellowish flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
